snippet: A half-century ago, Robert Moses turned over planning and development of the 1964 event’s entire 80-acre transportation area to the bistate agency.
abstract: David W Dunlap Building Blocks column; Robert Moses turned over planning and development of 1964 World's Fair's entire 80-acre transportation area to bistate agency that would later become Port Authority of New York and New Jersey; legacy of odd assignment is set of curious architectural drawings that reveal how Port Authority once had whimsical streak.
lead_paragraph: A half-century ago, Robert Moses turned over planning and development of the 1964 event’s entire 80-acre transportation area to the bistate agency.

headline.main: World’s Fair Showed a Different Side of the Port Authority
headline.print_headline: World’s Fair Showed a Different Side of the Port Authority

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
